clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Early Manual Therapy on Functional Outcomes After Volar Plating of Distal Radius Fractures
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Early Manual Therapy on Functional Outcomes After Volar Plating of Distal Radius Fractures: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study was to investigate the effects of early manual therapy on function, pain, range of motion (ROM), hand and pinch grip strength and disability level in patients underwent volar plating after distal radius fracture (DRF). Patients were randomly divided into two groups: Routin Physiotherapy (RP) or Early Manual Therapy (EMT). While RP group received routine physiotherapy, EMT group received routine physiotherapy plus Mulligan's Mobilization With Movement technique. All treatments were done two sessions a week, through 12 weeks. Function, pain, range of motion (ROM), hand and pinch grip strength and disability level of patients were assessed. Measurements were made at postoperative week 3, 6 and 12.

primary_outcome.description: Function was asssesed by using Patient Rated Wrist Evaluation (PRWE)

secondary_outcome.measure: change in the severity of pain
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of pain was assessed by using Visual Analogue Scale (VAS), which ranges between 0-10 points, 0 represents no pain and 10 denotes maximum pain intensity.

secondary_outcome.measure: change in the range of motion (ROM)
secondary_outcome.description: ROM was assesed by using an universal goniometer

secondary_outcome.measure: change in hand and pinch grip strength
secondary_outcome.description: hand and pinch grip strength was assesed by using hydrolic hand and finger dynamometers.
Disability level was assesed by using Disabilities of Arm, Shoulder and Hand (DASH) questionnaire.

arm_group.description: Routine physiotherapy program plus Mulligan's Mobilization with Movement technique were applied.
Only routine physiotherapy program was applied

intervention.description: Mulligan's Mobilization with Movement technique for radiocarpal,ulnocarpal, distal radioulnar and proximal radioulnar joints was applied.
Routine physiotherapy program consisted of range of motion, flexibility and strengthening exercises, and home exercise program was applied.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- An age of eighteen years or older
- An unstable fracture of the distal end of the radius
- Fixation with a volar locking plate
- Able to read, write, and understand Turkish
- Willing and able to attend the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous fracture on the injured side
- Concurrent fracture in contralateral upper extremity
- Accompanied bony and soft tissue injuries other than radius fracture
- Inflammatory joint diseases, metabolic diseases and neurological diseases
- Mental and cognitive disorders that would seriously affect cooperation
